definition: at sixes and sevens/perturbed state of mind/in a mess
seven/7
on top/upon/above/upper/previous/first (of multiple parts)/to climb/to get onto/to go up/to attend (class or university)
see 上聲|上声[shang3 sheng1]
eight/8
down/downwards/below/lower/later/next (week etc)/second (of two parts)/to decline/to go down/to arrive at (a decision, conclusion etc)/measure word to show the frequency of an action

sentences.english: I'm ta sixes and sevens about what to do.
sentences.chinese: 我的心七上八下的，不知做什麼好。

sentences.english: No, I can't, for I'm greatly upset now.
sentences.chinese: 我沒辦法，因爲我的心現在七上八下的。

sentences.english: When Ithink about leaving, I get butterflies in my stomach.
sentences.chinese: 當我一想到離開，內心就七上八下的。

sentences.english: I had got so uneasy I could not set still.
sentences.chinese: 我心裏七上八下，坐也不安穩。

sentences.english: When I met my teacher for the first time I had butterflies in my stomach.
sentences.chinese: 當我第一次去見我的老師時，我心裏緊張得七上八下。

sentences.english: His mind was in a turmoil these days and he was quite unable to think straight.
sentences.chinese: 他這幾天心裏七上八下，老是寧靜不下來。

sentences.english: The news disturbed him so that he cound't get any peace of mind.
sentences.chinese: 這條消息弄得他心裏七上八下，怎麼也不得安寧。

sentences.english: My heart seven up eight down.
I've got butterflies in my stomach because the only thing I've ever surfed is websites.
sentences.chinese: 我心裏七上八下，因爲我唯一會做的只有上網。

sentences.english: I am at sixes and sevens about what to do.
sentences.chinese: 我心中七上八下，拿不定主意該怎麼辦。

definition: restless/apprehensive
to be on tenterhooks (idiom)/to be anxious and frightened
unsure/uncertain/unending
one's thoughts in a whirl (idiom); confused/disconcerted/upset
to jump about/(of the heart) to beat wildly
nervous/apprehensive
unable to sit or stand still (out of nervousness etc) (idiom)
to hesitate/to have second thoughts/to be concerned/to brood (over sth)/to complain
lit. agitated sitting or standing (idiom)/restless/fidgety
confused/rattled/flustered
to feel weak/to be diffident
to beat a drum/to play a drum/(fig.) to feel nervous
out of one's wits (idiom)/distracted/stunned
to feel terrified/to grow apprehensive
thumping sound (onom.)/to be eager and anxious (to do sth)/faithful and upright
felt a chill (in one's heart)/(one's heart) sank
